p: 3-(4,5-Dimethylthiazol-2-Yl)-2,5-diphenyltetrazolium bromide (MTT) cell viability assay was used to determine the cytotoxicity of the extract and AgNPs in MCF-7 cells. The percent growth inhibition of the MCF-7 cells at different doses (5, 10, 20, 25, 50, 100 and 200 μg/mL) was compared to that of untreated cells. Figure 7(a) shows a concentration-dependent growth inhibition of in vitro cultured breast cancer cells. The IC 50 value was calculated as 12.35 μg/mL for AgNP-treated cells and 25.09 μg/mL for extract-treated cells. This 50% cytotoxic concentration was used for further experiments in this study. Earlier studies report the same type of results studying the effect of green-synthesized AgNPs in MCF-7 cells [ 22, 65, 66].
